intro: Pleurothallis erosa, commonly known as the rose orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a small, epiphytic orchid that typically grows on trees or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, linear leaves and produces clusters of fragrant, white or pale pink flowers with a distinctive, rose-like appearance. Its flowers are often short-lived but attract various pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts for its beauty and unique floral structure.
